posts.cooked: Our team is trying to implement swerve through YAGSL for the first time this year. We physically zeroed the angle motors and then got the reading from SmartdashBoard to use as the encoder offset however when rechecking SmartdashBoard the readings are still the same. What could be the problem?
Without your code i don’t know! There is a fallback to your relative encoder if the absolute encoder fails to resolve so my guess is that is what’s happening
Sorry our code is hosted here: GitHub - WolverineRobotics/2025CompRobot at swerve- YAGSL
Can you send a photo of how you connected your thrifty encoders to the roboRIO

I don’t know if this is good enough but here are some pictures of the wiring for the encoders BellyPan 1920×2560 490 KB Module 1920×2560 390 KB Rio 1920×2560 418 KB

BellyPan 1920×2560 490 KB

BellyPan 1920×2560 490 KB

Module 1920×2560 390 KB

Module 1920×2560 390 KB

Rio 1920×2560 418 KB

Rio 1920×2560 418 KB

Literally just fixed this issue in the discord. Lets try the same thing here!

Flip the PWM cable in the RIO
We tried fliping the PWM cable however it didn’t change anything and the module offsets are still not being applied
Did you flip it at both ends or just one. You were supposed to flip it at just one.

We flipped on the RIO end only however the even when we rotated the modules by hand the reading still stayed at around 18 degrees. There’s a video in the zip file as well if it helps frozenEncoder.zip (10.4 MB)
Not really. Are you in the discord?
